metadata.title: CVE-2019-20367 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
nlist.c in libbsd before 0.10.0 has an out-of-bounds read during acomparison for a symbol name from the string table (strtab).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20367` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libbsd0 - 0.6.0-2ubuntu1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libbsd package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.6.0-2ubuntu1+esm1').
